features.name: Alchemist Proficiencies
features.desc: Alchemists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and bombs. They are also proficient with light armor, but not with shields.

features.name: Bomb
features.desc:
In addition to magical extracts, alchemists are adept at swiftly mixing various volatile chemicals and infusing them with their magical reserves to create powerful bombs that they can hurl at their enemies. An alchemist can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an alchemist's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to the alchemist's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an alchemist's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered alchemist level. Splash damage from an alchemist bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of fire damage on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of fire damage). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's Intelligence modifier.

features.name: Mutagen
features.desc:
At 1st level, an alchemist discovers how to create a mutagen that he can imbibe in order to heighten his physical prowess at the cost of his personality.
It's a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to drink a mutagen. Upon being imbibed, the mutagen causes the alchemist to grow bulkier and more bestial, granting him a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 alchemical bonus to the selected {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} for 10 minutes per alchemist level. In addition, while the mutagen is in effect, the alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to one of his mental ability scores. If the mutagen enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.

features.name: Throw Anything
features.desc: All alchemists gain the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat at 1st level. An alchemist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} done with splash weapons, including the splash damage if any.

features.name: Brew Potions
features.desc: Allows you to brew potions of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} up to level 3 during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camping{/g}.

features.name: Discovery
features.desc: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter, an alchemist makes an incredible alchemical discovery. At 20th level, the alchemist makes an additional discovery. Unless otherwise noted, an alchemist cannot select an individual discovery more than once. Some discoveries can only be made if the alchemist has met certain prerequisites first, such as uncovering other discoveries. Only one such discovery can be applied to an individual bomb. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

features.name: Poison Resistance
features.desc: At 2nd level, an alchemist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. This bonus increases to +4 at 5th level, and then again to +6 at 8th level. At 10th level, an alchemist becomes completely immune to poison.

features.name: Poison Immunity
features.desc: At 10th level, an alchemist becomes completely immune to poison.

features.name: Persistent Mutagen
features.desc: At 14th level, the effects of a mutagen last for 1 hour per level.

features.name: Grand Discovery
features.desc: At 20th level, the alchemist makes a grand discovery. For many alchemists, the promise of one of these grand discoveries is the primary goal of their experiments and hard work.

features.name: Precise Bomb
features.desc: When the alchemist throws a bomb, it doesn't affect allies.

features.name: Directed Blast
features.desc: At 6th level, a grenadier can detonate a bomb so that it splashes in a 30-foot cone rather than affecting a radius. The cone starts at the alchemist and extends away from her in the direction she chooses. Each creature within the cone takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it had suffered a direct hit from the alchemist's bomb, but succeeding at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) halves the damage.

features.name: Staggering Blast
features.desc: At 10th level, a grenadier's bombs become particularly overwhelming when they explode. Whenever a grenadier scores a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} with a bomb, the creature directly struck by that bomb is staggered for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equals the bomb's Reflex save DC to avoid splash {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}) reduces the duration to 1 round.

features.name: Alchemical Weapon
features.desc: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, such as an acid flask or alchemist's fire. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not doubled on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.

features.name: Throw Anything
features.desc: You receive a +1 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made with thrown splash weapons.

features.name: Martial Weapons Proficiency
features.desc: You become proficient with all Martial Weapons.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Advanced Talents
features.desc: After 10th level, a character can choose one of the advanced rogue talents in place of a rogue talent.

features.name: Medical Discovery
features.desc: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter (up to 18th level), a vivesectionist makes an incredible medical discovery. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the vivisectionist's level + the vivisectionist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

features.name: Infused Curative
features.desc: At 2nd level, a chirurgeon's extracts of remove disease, remove blindness, neutralize poison, and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} automatically act as infusions and can be used not only on himself but on other people as well.

features.name: Skill Focus — Lore (Religion)
features.desc: You get a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} involving {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}. If you have 10 or more ranks in Lore (religion), this bonus increases to +6.

features.name: Power Over Death
features.desc: At 10th level, a chirurgeon adds breath of life to his formula book as a 4th-level extract. His infused curative ability applies to this extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally I
features.desc: At 2nd level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally I to his formula book as a 1st-level extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally II
features.desc: At 5th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally II to his formula book as a 2nd-level extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally III
features.desc: At 8th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally IV to his formula book as a 3rd-level extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally IV
features.desc: At 10th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally V to his formula book as a 4th-level extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally V
features.desc: At 14th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally VII to his formula book as a 5th-level extract.

features.name: Bottled Ally VI
features.desc: At 18 level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally IX to his formula book as a 6th-level extract.

features.name: Class Skills
features.desc: A metamorph adds {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Adaptive Physiology
features.desc: At 3rd level, a metamorph gains a 25% chance to negate {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, similar to the preserve organs discovery. This chance increases to 50% at 6th level, and to 75% at 18th level.

features.name: Shapechanger
features.desc:
A metamorph gains the ability to transform herself into another form. The effect lasts for 1 hour per metamorph's alchemist level, or until she changes back. Changing form (to another form or back) is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The metamorph is fatigued for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} each time she changes shape.
A metamorph can use this ability twice per day at 4th level and an additional time per day every 2 alchemist levels thereafter, for a total of ten times at 20th level.
This ability functions as beast shape I at 4th level, as beast shape II at 9th level, as beast shape III at 11th level, as beast shape IV or dragonkind I at 13th level, and as dragonkind II at 15th level.
This ability replaces alchemy (which also includes bombs, extracts, and mutagen) and Throw Anything.

features.name: Beast Shape I
features.desc:
You become a medium wolf. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +2 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 20 feet. You also gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the tripping bite ability.
Tripping Bite: A wolf can attempt to trip its opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} if it hits with bite attack.

features.name: Beast Shape II
features.desc: You become a Medium leopard. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +2 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. You also gain two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and one 1d6 bite attack.

features.name: Beast Shape III
features.desc:
You become a Large bear. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, one 1d6 bite attack, and the rend ability.
Rend: When a bear hits an opponent with both its claws, it deals an additional 1d6 plus 1–1/2 times its Strength modifier points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g}. It can only deal this additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Beast Shape IV
features.desc: You become a Large smilodon, a Large shambling mound or a Large wyvern.

features.name: Dragonkind I
features.desc: You become a medium dragon-like creature. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}), two claws (1d6), and two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d4). Your breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of your dragon prototype. You can only use the breath weapon once per casting of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. All breath weapons deal 6d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.

features.name: Dragonkind II
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as dragonkind I except that it also allows you to assume the form of a large dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d8), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6), and one tail slap attack (1d8). You can only use the breath weapon twice per casting of this spell (when you use it, the duration of your breath weapon ability is reduced by 1/2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minutes), and you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 80-foot lines and cones increase to 40-foot cones.

features.name: Incense Fog
features.desc: A 1st-level incense synthesizer can use his ability to create incense fog in a 15-foot area around him to aid his allies (including himself), improving their combat abilities. An affected ally receives a +1 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.

features.name: Incense
features.desc: A incense synthesizer learns a number of alchemical tricks, called incenses, which grant ally powers or weaken foes. At 3rd level, a incense synthesizer learns one incense. At 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th and 18th level, the incense synthesizer learns new incense. A incense synthesizer cannot select a incense more than once unless noted otherwise.

name: Alchemist
desc: The alchemist's reputation is not softened by his exuberance (some would say dangerous recklessness) in perfecting his magical extracts and potion-like creations, infusing these substances with magic siphoned from his aura and using his own body as experimental stock. Nor is it mollified by the alchemist's almost gleeful passion for building explosive bombs and discovering strange new poisons and methods for their use. These {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}traits{/g}, while making him a liability and risk for most civilized organizations and institutions of higher learning, seem to fit quite well with most adventuring groups.

archetypes.name: Grenadier
archetypes.desc: Grenadiers train to exercise their talents in the thick of battle, even when not under the influence of their mutagens. They learn methods of combining weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with their alchemical magic, and sacrifice {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} with poisons in order to become more adept at using alchemical bombs or using alchemical items in conjunction with their martial skills. As an unusual side effect of their skill at handling bombs and alchemical items with increased {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, grenadiers master the ability to drink potions, elixirs, and mutagens quickly and safely, without exposing themselves to peril while doing so.

archetypes.name: Vivisectionist
archetypes.desc: A vivisectionist studies bodies to better understand their function. Unlike a chirurgeon, a vivisectionist's goals are not related to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}, but rather to experimentation and knowledge that most people would consider evil.

archetypes.name: Chirurgeon
archetypes.desc: An alchemist who studies anatomy and uses this knowledge to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} is a chirurgeon.

archetypes.name: Preservationist
archetypes.desc: Preservationist is an alchemist who keeps preserved specimens in bottles, and releases them to aid him in his battles.

archetypes.name: Metamorph
archetypes.desc: Metamorphs eschew traditional alchemy, focusing on internal chemistry and the transfiguration of living forms.

archetypes.name: Incense Synthesizer
archetypes.desc: Some alchemists focus their efforts on researching different kinds of incenses to aid them and their allies in battle against the forces of evil.
